nodes.title: North slope structures
nodes.body: Below the north summit tomb, at a distance of 40 m, there are the remains of another enclosure (2.5 m x 2.5 m). Its walls reach a maximum height of 50 cm. Farther down the north slope there appears to be the remains of a cubic grave, leveled to its foundation (5040 m).

nodes.title: East slope tombs
nodes.body: Just the below the summit, on the east flank of the mountain, there are two cubic tombs spaced 11 m apart. The south specimen measures 1.5 m x 1.5 m x 60 cm (height) and the north specimen measures 1.7 m x 1.8 m x 60 cm.

nodes.title: West slope tombs
nodes.body: There are also two cubic tombs on the west slope, just below the summit. The west sides of these specimens were constructed against a boulder. The south specimen (1.5 m x 1.5 m x 1 m) has a well-preserved rectangular central depository (60 cm x 40 cm x 70 cm [depth]). The adjacent north tomb (1.6 m x 1.4 m x 90 cm) also has the benefit of its central depository, which is a little smaller than its counterpart (30 cm x 50 cm x 60 cm).

nodes.title: South slope tomb
nodes.body: On the south flank of smyug ri, just below the south summit tomb, there is another specimen, which has been reduced to its foundation.

nodes.title: Affiliated sites
nodes.body: There is reported to be two funerary superstructures, of the enclosure type, near the west foot of Nyuk RiSmyug ri.
